intro: Cyrtandra tibangensis, commonly known as the Tibang mountain ginger, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and clustered inflorescences. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are often clustered in racemes. Its leaves are typically lanceolate and covered with a dense layer of short, stiff hairs. Cyrtandra tibangensis is adapted to cool, moist environments and is often found in mountain forests at elevations above 2,500 meters.
